fi.lyma.minesweeper.logic

Class MinesweeperGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.lyma.minesweeper.logic.MinesweeperGame

  • public class MinesweeperGame
extends Object
    MinesweeperGame is the class responsible for holding the reference to the actual Minefield object and tracking the state of the game and time spent. All interactions with the field should happen through MinesweeperGame.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MinesweeperGame.GameStatus
      Represents the state of a MinesweeperGame object.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      static int MAXIMUM_GAME_FIELD_SIDE_LENGTH
      Minefield height or width can't exceed this values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinesweeperGame

        Constructs Minefield.
        Parameters:
        gameMode - GameMode for construction Minefield
        See Also:
        createNewField(GameMode)

    • Method Detail

      • createNewField

        public final void createNewField(GameMode gameMode)
        Constructs Minefield with given GameMode. If the GameMode is invalid. GameMode.MEDIUM is used instead. GameMode is invalid if
        • width or height is less or equal to 0
        • width or height is greater than MAXIMUM_GAME_FIELD_SIDE_LENGTH
        • number of mines is greater than width*height-9
        Parameters:
        gameMode - GameMode for construction Minefield

      • getTile

        public ImmutableTile getTile(Vector2D<Integer> location)
        Returns ImmutableTile in the specified location.
        Parameters:
        location - Location of the tile
        Returns:
        ImmutableTile or null if the location was outside the bounds

      • openTile

        public void openTile(Vector2D<Integer> location,
                     boolean quickOpen)
        Opens tile in the minefield in the specified location. Starts the game if it's not already started.
        Parameters:
        location - Location of the tile that is tried to be opened
        quickOpen - False to use normal open and true to use quick open
        See Also:
        Minefield.tryOpeningTile(Vector2D), Minefield.tryQuickOpening(Vector2D)

      • flagTile

        public void flagTile(Vector2D<Integer> location)
        Flags tile in specified location.
        Parameters:
        location - Location of the tile that is tried to be flagged
        See Also:
        Minefield.tryFlaggingTile(Vector2D)

      • isGameEnded

        public boolean isGameEnded()
        Returns whether game has ended.
        Returns:
        True if game status is ENDED_LOSS or ENDED_WIN, otherwise false.

      • getTimeSpent

        public long getTimeSpent()
        Return time spent since the start of the game.
        Returns:
        Time in milliseconds since tha game started

      • getGameStatus

        public MinesweeperGame.GameStatus getGameStatus()

      • getGameMode

        public GameMode getGameMode()

      • getNumberOfMinesRemaining

        public int getNumberOfMinesRemaining()
        Return the number of potential non-flagged mines. Even if flag is placed in wrong location, it is counted.
        Returns:
        Number of non-flagged mines

      • getAdjacentClosedNonFlaggedTiles

        public List<ImmutableTile> getAdjacentClosedNonFlaggedTiles(Vector2D<Integer> location)
        Returns list of the adjacent squares around specified location that are closed and not flagged.
        Parameters:
        location - Location that specifies the adjacent tiles
        Returns:
        List of the adjacent tiles

      • addGameStateListener

        public void addGameStateListener(GameStateListener gameStateListener)
        Adds listener to be notified for change on MinesweeperGame.GameStatus.
        Parameters:
        gameStateListener - Listener to add

        public void removeGameStateListener(GameStateListener gameStateListener)
        Removes listener.
        Parameters:
